intro: Matricaria tanacetifolia, commonly known as German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and grasslands. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is widely used in aromatherapy and herbal medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
